cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly northwest, then turning north and north-northeast while paralleling the U.S. East Coast toward the Carolinas and later New England/Atlantic Canada
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: North Carolina coast (near Cape Fear–Cape Lookout area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and tropical storm/hurricane watches extend from north of Deerfield Beach, FL to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm-surge warning Lantana, FL to Savannah River; Hurricane warning Jupiter Inlet, FL to Ponte Vedra Beach, FL; Tropical-storm warning adjacent segments of FL/GA coasts
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through the Carolinas, then Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coast including Cape Cod–Maine as the system accelerates northeastward
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤9% chance of sustained ≥34-kt winds; gusts 30–40 mph possible Friday night–Saturday)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; water-level rise below 3 ft for Boston Harbor
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate bands possible (1–3 in) Friday night–Saturday as Dorian passes southeast of Cape Cod
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells and dangerous rip currents may disrupt pilot boarding and small-craft operations beginning late Thursday and peaking Friday–Saturday
